news.title: Saba Capital activist Boaz Weinstein calls for removal of Baillie Gifford-run tech investment trust’s entire board
news.summary: Boaz Weinstein wants to replace the entire board of Baillie Gifford's EWI trust. Activist hedge fund manager Boaz Weinstein is chairman of the EWI Trust.

news.title: Apple is challenging India's antitrust body over a potential $38 billion fine
news.summary: Apple filed a lawsuit against the Competition Commission of India over how the body uses global turnover when calculating fines. Apple is challenging the body's decision to use global turnover to calculate fines. The lawsuit is expected to be settled in the next few months.

news.title: Judge dismisses Trump election interference racketeering case in Georgia
news.summary: Fulton County Superior Court Judge Scott McAfee's ruling ends the final case against Trump. The case remained unresolved after he returned to the White House.

news.title: Alibaba's AI glasses to rival Meta go on sale for $500
news.summary: Alibaba, like other tech giants such as Meta, are betting that smart glasses could be the next big consumer device after the smartphone.

news.title: Puma shares pop 14% after report China's Anta Sports is looking to buy the sportswear giant
news.summary: China's Anta Sports is among a number of firms looking to buy the German athletic brand, according to a media report. The German brand is owned by Adidas, a German sports brand.

news.title: My college-age kids inherited $300K from a 401(k). What should they do with this money?
news.summary: “This money is likely to be saved for the purchase of homes in 10 years or so,” he says. “It’s a good investment for the future.”

news.title: Relentless financial pressure has Black Friday shoppers of all incomes even more hungry for deals than usual
news.summary: After several years of rising prices and economic uncertainty, consumers are more focused on scoring the best deals. The best deals are often found on electronics and computer parts.

news.title: Stop and do this before you buy anything on Black Friday
news.summary: “Be sure to ‘pay yourself first’ before you spend a dollar on deals,” says financial planner. “Be careful with your spending,’’ adds financial planner, “don’t overspend.”

news.title: Doing your holiday shopping with a credit card? Use these 6 tips to preserve your credit score — and your sanity.
news.summary: A few key rules can keep you from slipping into a debt spiral, experts say. Americans will be leaning hard on their credit cards this holiday season.

news.title: Beware of this Black Friday scam
news.summary: “I received an email from eBay, or at least it looked like it was from an official eBay address,” he says. “I was like, ‘Oh my God.’”
